org.princehouse.mica.base

Class BaseProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.princehouse.mica.base.BaseProtocol
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Protocol
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CTRWPeerSampler, CTRWSamplerOverlay, Dilator, ExternalSelectProtocol, FailureDetector, FindMin, FindMinPullWeighted, FindMinPush, FindMinSymmetric, Merge, MinAddressLeaderElection, NaiveBroadcast, Pipeline, ProtocolAdapter, RingOverlayBuilder, RoundRobinMerge, RoundRobinMergeRate, TestLoggingRemoteLocal, TMan, TokenRing, TreeLabelNodes

    public abstract class BaseProtocol
extends java.lang.Object
implements Protocol, java.io.Serializable
    Base for all MiCA protocols. Extend this class to create your own protocol.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getRuntimeState

        public RuntimeState getRuntimeState()
        RuntimeState stores information associated with a running protocol instance, such as the current address and a random number generator seed.

      • getRate

        public double getRate()
        Rate is a multiplier for how fast a node gossips. getRate() is called by the MiCA runtime to determine how long to wait between gossips.
        Specified by:
        getRate in interface Protocol
        Returns:

      • getAddress

        public Address getAddress()
        Get the current node's address. This is part of RuntimeState. This method is here for convenience; it is the same as getRuntimeState().getAddress()
        Specified by:
        getAddress in interface Protocol
        Returns:
        Current node's address

      • logJson

        public void logJson(java.lang.Object flags,
           java.lang.String eventType)
        Convenience method for logging only an event type Flags is an enum from LogFlag enum.
        Specified by:
        logJson in interface Protocol
        Parameters:
        flags - An enum from LogFlag class; describes the category of the log message.
        eventType - An arbitrary string that will be written in the "event_type" attribute of the logged JSON message.

      • logJson

        public void logJson(java.lang.Object flags,
           java.lang.String eventType,
           java.lang.Object obj)
        Specified by:
        logJson in interface Protocol
        Parameters:
        flags - An enum from LogFlag class; describes the category of the log message.
        evenType - An arbitrary string that will be written in the "event_type" attribute of the logged JSON message.
        obj - An object to include with the log message. MiCA will attempt to serialize the object into JSON, but this may fail for custom data types.

      • rate

        public double rate()
        The default rate of all protocols is 1.0. Override this only if you specifically want to make this protocol gossip at a non-uniform rate (i.e., merge operators do this)
        Returns:
        Current gossip rate.

      • getLogState

        public java.lang.Object getLogState()
        Returns an object that will be serialized when logging state update messages. By default, this object is the protocol instance itself, but overriding this method can serialize an arbitrary object instead.
        Specified by:
        getLogState in interface Protocol
        Returns:
        JSON-serializable object representing node state for logging purposes

      • preUpdate

        public void preUpdate(Address selected)
        Called after getView, prior to initiating gossip. preUpdate will be called even if the sampled address is null.
        Specified by:
        preUpdate in interface Protocol

      • postUpdate

        public void postUpdate()
        Called on the node that initiates gossip after it has completed executing the gossip exchange.
        Specified by:
        postUpdate in interface Protocol

      • unreachable

        public void unreachable(Address peer)
        Called when MiCA fails to reach a peer for gossip, either due to timeout or connection refused
        Specified by:
        unreachable in interface Protocol
